overview.description: Uttar Pradesh, located in northern India, is known for its historical landmarks, religious sites, and cultural heritage. Established as a state on January 24, 1950, it features attractions like Varanasi and Agra.

top_destinations.name: Varanasi
top_destinations.description: The spiritual city with Ganges ghats and Kashi Vishwanath Temple.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Take a Ganga Aarti; wear comfortable shoes.

top_destinations.name: Agra
top_destinations.description: Home to the Taj Mahal and Agra Fort.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit Taj at sunrise; book tickets online.

top_destinations.name: Lucknow
top_destinations.description: Known for Bara Imambara and Nawabi culture.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Try local kebabs; visit Chota Imambara.

culinary_delights.name: Café Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

culinary_delights.name: Dasaprakash
culinary_delights.description: Popular for South Indian and North Indian fusion.

must_visit_spots.name: Taj Mahal
must_visit_spots.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site in Agra.
must_visit_spots.tip: Visit at sunrise for fewer crowds.

must_visit_spots.name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
must_visit_spots.description: A sacred Hindu temple in Varanasi.

must_visit_spots.name: Sarnath
must_visit_spots.description: Where Buddha delivered his first sermon.

must_visit_spots.name: Fatehpur Sikri
must_visit_spots.description: A deserted Mughal city near Agra.

must_visit_spots.name: Allahabad Fort
must_visit_spots.description: A historic fort on the banks of the Yamuna.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Agra is 200 km from Delhi (NH19, 3-4 hrs). By train: Varanasi Junction. By air: Chaudhary Charan Singh Airport (Lucknow).
travel_essentials.tips: Carry light clothing; avoid summer heat.
